ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: It is a challenging but excellent course. I have learned a lot from this course. No weaknesses at all. I will recommend it to others.
overall the course is very good. The only problem is the homework is to much and need a long time to learn it by ourselves.
it covers theory of survival analysis, but I think the structure of this course needs improvement

This course covers many classical topics in survival analysis, introducing the theoretical framework behind the frequently used methods, which helps students to understand those methods in depth. Lectures are interesting and go into necessary details. My advice, if any, would be balancing the frequency of homework before and after the midterm so that students can maintain the same level of engagement.

This course offers us a relatively comprehensive view of theoretical survival analysis. Most of the content in this course is quite hardcore and a thorough understanding requires solid stochastic process background. The pace of this course is a bit fast and requires a lot of after efforts to keep up with. Also, assignments from this course are mostly further extension of lecture, which makes this course even tougher. So it takes quite some efforts and time to be in this course, but it is also rewarding if you could make it.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Shuangge Ma  Excellent instructor! Theory of Survival is the most difficult course in our department. It's more like a "statistical" course. However, professor Ma make it interesting.
Instructor: Shuangge Ma  He is a good teacher. He can explain something complicated in a very straight forward way. And he is good to students.
Instructor: Shuangge Ma  I wish there are more assignments to assists the understanding of theories for each class.

Instructor: Shuangge Ma  Dr. Ma is very responsive to students' questions and always provides helpful advice. He is also willing to consider students' suggestions for teaching/homework assignment and so on.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great course! I definitely will recommend it to other PhD students. Because it is necessary and important to learn some theoretical survival as a PhD student, and the instructor is wonderful.
I will recommend it to biostat students. But this course maybe too hard for students who do not have stats background.
For students interested in theoretical aspects of survival analysis, I would recommend this course to them.
